item.title: NSF GRFP Virtual Bootcamp begins August 4th
item.description: Date: Monday, August 4, 2025 (all day) - Complete online modules at your own pace. Develop strong application materials for this 3 year fellowship which provides salary and tuition for graduate school. Fall 2025 seniors, 1st and 2nd year grad students in STEM fields that do not already hold a graduate degree are eligible. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency required. For info:madige@rpi.edu Feedback on application materials available for all applicants. Register: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe…

item.title: Multiple Paving Projects, July 16th - August 6th
item.description: Please be advised that the Site Services Department will be overseeing multiple paving projects within the coming weeks. We will be repaving sidewalks in the following areas: Around the Rensselaer Student Union, West Lot, Albright Lot, all sidewalks surrounding Albright, Cook Drive from the circle in front of the Houston Field House to the intersection of Sunset Avenue and sidewalks between the buildings in Stacwyck.

item.title: Nominations for the RAA Teaching Award Sought
item.description: Date: 7/23/2025 to 7/31/2025 Nominations are being accepted for the 2025 Rensselaer Alumni Association (RAA) Teaching Award, and are due by July 31, 2025. This award recognizes current members of the faculty for their outstanding teaching techniques, contributions to the campus experience, and commitment to students. For more information or to submit a nomination, visit https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form…
item.author: Community

item.title: Students, Faculty and Staff with Windows 10 on personal computers not managed by RPI
item.description: Microsoft Windows 10 support ends on October 14th, 2025. This means that as of this date, Windows 10 systems will cease to be eligible for support including important security patches. Without appropriate mitigation, Windows 10 systems and your data will be at significant risk. Additionally, they will be non-compliant with multiple RPI security policies and may be denied access to the campus network to reduce risk and maintain a secure cybersecurity posture. Click in for recommendations.
item.author: Community

item.title: HelioCampus Browser Support Change - Effective July 2025
item.description:
HelioCampus, our tool for syllabus, assessment and course evaluations is streamlining their browser support to focus on the following most widely used browsers: Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Apple Safari.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
